website_summaries.verdict: One of the best beginner-focused Java programming books focused on simple instructions and examples.
pros: Included coding projects are easy and quick to follow, and offer practical experience with real world applications
Covers the primary changes and additions with the Java 9 update
cons: Some coding terms are left undefined, potentially confusing first time programmers new to Java

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner's Guide!
customer_reviews.text: My son is taking a programming class in high school and wasn't quite getting it. We bought this as a supplement to his class and it has completely replaced it. He is ahead of everyone in his class as during his study halls he reads this book. He is quite pleased with it and wants to learn another programming language and we will definitely look at this publisher for that one too!
customer_reviews.author: BethN

customer_reviews.title: NOT just for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by the subtitle. Along with beginners, experienced JAVA programmers, or programmers coming back to Java after a few years away may also find this volume useful, along with the "Complete Guide". I fall into the latter category, and found it to be a good refresher of the language and a good introduction to the latest version of the SDK. It provides a lot of "Hey, I remember this from a previous version" type Q&A dialogs that help explain what has changed, and why. A great learning and reference tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Warrior

customer_reviews.title: The best Java 9 book.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to learn Java, this is the book for you. Herbert Schildt takes you through basic to more advanced topics, ecerything is nicely explained without complicated jargon. This is the seventh edition and covers the new released Java 9. Also, this is a great book as reference for more experienced programmers who wants to keep updated on the new features of Java 9.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat

customer_reviews.text: So far it’s pretty helpful. The book I use for class is more of a supplement compared to this book. I only had it for a day so I will update my review later. customer_reviews.title: Works for me....
customer_reviews.text: This book is really helping me get to grips with Java. I have bought a ton of books for a degree course I am undertaking. They all pale in comparison to this one. YMMV but this one works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Best if you already have basic knowledge of programminh
customer_reviews.text: Very informative and detailed, however its not super beginner friendly. Would recommend using online advice to help you along the way while reading this book of maybe cross reference with an abdolute beginning noob book to help.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to programming in general, as well as Java.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the book in a Linux CLI envrionment. Was a great book for a overview of programming in general. Will serve me well when I go on to study other languages. I am going to continue my study of C based languages with Java the Complete Reference 10th ed. and a C++ book.
customer_reviews.author: Georg Cantor

customer_reviews.title: book is easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: New to Java, book is easy to follow, and explains topics well.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Mannino

customer_reviews.title: You will learn a lot.
customer_reviews.text: The best book. It takes you step by step, in such a gradual way that makes each chapter fun and engaging to learn from. I used to try to learn from the java website tutorials and couldn't wrap my head around some of the concepts. After reading this book if learned so much about classes, subclasses, objects, methods, arrays that my confidence as a self taught developer is improving. Highly recommend this book.

customer_reviews.title: A great help
